description: Egypt is a transcontinental country linking northeast Africa with the Middle East, known for its ancient civilization, iconic monuments, and the Nile River.
location: Located in North Africa, bordered by the Mediterranean Sea to the north and the Red Sea to the east.
attractions: Valley of the Kings in Luxor
Red Sea Resorts (Hurghada, Sharm El Sheikh)

description: Cairo is Egypt's bustling capital, rich in Islamic and ancient history.
location: Located on the eastern banks of the Nile in northern Egypt.

description: Alexandria is a Mediterranean port city founded by Alexander the Great.
location: Located on Egypt's northern coast along the Mediterranean Sea.

description: Luxor is an ancient city known as the world’s greatest open-air museum.
location: Located in southern Egypt on the east bank of the Nile.

description: Aswan is a quiet Nile-side city rich in Nubian culture and natural beauty.
location: Located in southern Egypt along the Nile River.

description: Taba is a small Egyptian town on the northern tip of the Gulf of Aqaba.
location: Located in eastern Sinai, near the Israeli border.
attractions: Pharaoh’s Island and Salah El-Din Citadel
Diving and Snorkeling in the Gulf of Aqaba

description: Hurghada is a vibrant Red Sea resort town known for its beaches and coral reefs.
location: Located on the western shore of the Red Sea in eastern Egypt.

description: Sharm El-Sheikh is a major Red Sea resort city known for luxury tourism and marine life.
location: Located on the southern tip of the Sinai Peninsula.

description: Faiyum is one of Egypt’s oldest cities, rich in archaeological and natural beauty.
location: Located southwest of Cairo in a large depression of the Western Desert.

description: Dahab is a laid-back beach town popular with backpackers and divers.
location: Located on the southeast coast of the Sinai Peninsula.

description: Siwa is a remote oasis known for its Berber culture, hot springs, and salt lakes.
location: Located in the Western Desert near the Libyan border.

description: Port Said is a canal city with colonial architecture and maritime heritage.
location: Located at the northern entrance of the Suez Canal on the Mediterranean coast.

description: Suez is a strategic port city and industrial center near the Red Sea.
location: Located at the southern end of the Suez Canal.

description: Al Minya is a historical city in Upper Egypt with ancient ruins and Coptic heritage.
location: Located on the west bank of the Nile River in central Egypt.

description: Ismailia is a peaceful city on the Suez Canal with green parks and colonial charm.
location: Located halfway along the Suez Canal between Port Said and Suez.

description: Asyut is a large Upper Egyptian city known for its cultural and religious heritage.
location: Located on the west bank of the Nile River in central Egypt.

description: The iconic ancient wonders, including the Great Pyramid of Khufu, Pyramid of Khafre, and Pyramid of Menkaure. The last remaining Ancient Wonder of the World.
Home to the Step Pyramid of Djoser, the oldest complete stone building in the world, and various mastabas (ancient tombs).
Site of the Bent Pyramid and the Red Pyramid, early examples of pyramid construction.
A vast open-air museum and the largest ancient religious site in the world, featuring massive halls, obelisks, and statues.
Beautifully illuminated at night, this temple was once connected to Karnak by an avenue of sphinxes.
The burial ground for pharaohs of the New Kingdom, including Tutankhamun's tomb.
Burial site for queens and royal children, notably the Tomb of Nefertari.
A stunning terraced temple dedicated to the female pharaoh Hatshepsut.
Two massive stone statues of Pharaoh Amenhotep III.
Houses a remarkable collection of artifacts from the Theban region.
attractions: Royal Mummies of Ahmose I and Ramesses I

description: A well-preserved temple with intricate reliefs depicting military campaigns and religious scenes.
Known for its beautifully preserved reliefs and the Abydos King List, which provides a chronological list of most dynastic pharaohs.
One of the best-preserved temples in Egypt, dedicated to the goddess Hathor, with stunning astrological ceilings.
A beautiful temple complex relocated to Agilkia Island to save it from the Aswan High Dam. Dedicated to the goddess Isis.
Two massive rock-cut temples dedicated to Ramses II and his wife Nefertari, famously relocated to save them from flooding.
A giant obelisk still attached to the bedrock in a granite quarry, providing insight into ancient quarrying techniques.
A modern marvel of engineering that controls the Nile's floods and created Lake Nasser.
Experience the colorful culture, unique architecture, and hospitality of the Nubian people.
The resting place of Aga Khan III, with stunning views of the Nile.
Houses the world's largest collection of ancient Egyptian artifacts, including the treasures of Tutankhamun. (GEM is planned to be the main national museum.)
A UNESCO World Heritage site filled with medieval mosques, madrassas, and historical buildings.
A medieval Islamic fortress with panoramic views of Cairo, home to the Mosque of Muhammad Ali.
A vibrant and historic market for souvenirs, spices, traditional crafts, and street food.
A historic area with ancient churches, including the Hanging Church, Church of St. Sergius and Bacchus, and Ben Ezra Synagogue.
attractions: Hanging Church (Saint Virgin Mary's Coptic Orthodox Church)
Church of St. Sergius and Bacchus

description: Features a magnificent 'Mummies Royal Hall' showcasing royal mummies in a state-of-the-art facility.
Offers panoramic views of the city from its observation deck.
A modern architectural marvel honoring the ancient Library of Alexandria, serving as a major cultural center.
A 15th-century fortress built on the site of the ancient Lighthouse of Alexandria.
A Roman-era necropolis with a unique blend of Egyptian, Roman, and Greek art and architecture.
A massive Roman column, part of the ancient Serapion complex.
Remains of a Roman theater in the city center, offering insight into ancient entertainment.
Beautiful gardens surrounding a former royal palace (Montaza Palace), offering a peaceful escape.
Experience the beauty of the Nile while visiting ancient temples and tombs along its banks.

location: Hurghada, Sharm El Sheikh, Dahab, Marsa Alam
description: A paradise for diving, snorkeling, and beach holidays with vibrant coral reefs and diverse marine life.
A protected area at the southern tip of the Sinai Peninsula, renowned for its diverse marine life and coral reefs.
Popular for day trips, snorkeling, diving, and relaxing on pristine sandy beaches.
A surreal landscape with chalk rock formations sculpted by wind, creating unique 'mushroom' and 'ice cream cone' shapes.
A remote and unique oasis with ancient ruins, salt lakes, hot springs, and a distinct Berber culture.
attractions: Temple of the Oracle (Temple of Amun)

description: A UNESCO World Heritage site famous for its exceptionally preserved fossilized whale skeletons from an ancient ocean.
A significant religious site, believed to be where Moses received the Ten Commandments. Many hike to the summit for sunrise.

location: Sinai Peninsula, at the foot of Mount Sinai
description: One of the oldest continuously inhabited Christian monasteries in the world, home to invaluable manuscripts and icons.
A natural geological formation with stunning rock colors and formations, perfect for hiking and exploring.
A historic port city at the northern entrance of the Suez Canal, known for its colonial-era architecture.
A seaport city at the southern end of the Suez Canal, historically significant.
A charming city on the west bank of the Suez Canal, known for its green spaces and French colonial architecture.
A beautiful Mediterranean coastal city with stunning clear waters and pristine beaches.
